commits.message: bump version
Bug 1427669 - Fix MacOS X installs with recent versions of Firefox (#480)
Fix tests
Bump versions

Allow sideloading extensions by default (#476)

Otherwise the --addon option doesn't work. See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Add-ons/WebExtensions/Alternative_distribution_options/Add-ons_in_the_enterprise

Bump mozrunner/mozprofile versions (#475)

Notably this makes the --addon parameter work for web extensions (at least
to install them). See https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1420447
bump versions
Add 58, update comment about how we add releases (#474)
bump versions

Ensure all environment variables encoded as ascii when launching firefox (#468)

It seems in certain cases, we were trying to pass unicode or integer
values to the process runner, which resulted in an error.

See: https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/issues/972#issuecomment-336475663
Bug 1408350 - Disable health report uploads altogether (#470)

Use latest version of setuptools in travis (#471)

Older versions incorrectly try to install an incorrect version
of the cryptography library.
bump versions
Fix python versioning check
Add 56, 57 versions
Use appveyor's version of nsis
Update location of pyqt4 for windows appveyor builds
Bump versions
Use newer mozprocess (#463)

Use precise with travis (#462)

Trusty seems to have some problems with cx_freeze which aren't worth figuring out right now.
Bump versions

Make sure long temporary path names are not shortened inside mozregression (#458)

If they aren't, we have sandboxing problems: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1385928
Bump versions

Awesome new app icon for mozregression

Thanks to Victoria Wang <victoria@mozilla.com>

pull_requests.title: Bug 1234029 - use debug builds from archives.m.o
pull_requests.body:
For firefox and jsshell, provides access to debug builds using
archives.m.o.

Those builds are stored using 'debug' in their filename, and
using TaskCluster is not required anymore.

commit_comments.body: Oops! Touche, messed up my git commit. Will fix.
I will investigate what's involved here. :)

review_comments.body: Addressed line continuation, but decided to leave it as "filter" since I think it amounts to more or less the same thing.
Nope. Fixed. :)
This makes sense, I think, but could we apply it as a seperate patch? I think it belongs to another bug.

I'd prefer:

```
 base_url = 'http://inbound-archive.pub.build.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org' \
     '/firefox/tinderbox-builds/%s' % inbound_branch
```
This looks like an accidental change. Rebasing on current master should fix it.

I think we should rename "repo_name" to "inbound_branch". I know "inbound_branch" doesn't really make sense in the context of nightlies, but at least that's more clear that it doesn't, if that makes any sense. Maybe eventually we can create an "options" class we can pass around for this sort of stuff in the future.
I think we should abort with an error if both good_release and good_date (and/or both bad_release and bad_date) are specified.
I agree with cpeterson, we shouldn't try to anticipate the future. So let's take 35+ out (although we might put 35 back in if the merge happens before we apply this patch). :)

I think I agree with cpeterson here as well -- the accept_release stuff is a bit overcomplicated for what we need here. Let's take it out and just convert release numbers to dates during the parsing stage.
Thanks for writing tests here. :)
Don't need the \ here
Please add a type='int' kwarg here.

commits.message:
typo in main.py (#477)

in in -> in

pull_requests.title: typo in test_main.py (followup of typo in main.py)

commits.message: Bug 1414879 - Avoid privacy notice on every launch (#473)

Fix typo in message about 64-bit systems (#472)

Right now the message about default build type (64-bit vs. 32-bit) incorrectly refers to them as "64 bits" and "32 bits".  The correct/common adjective for these types of builds are "64-bit" vs. "32-bit" (singular bits, and with a hyphen).  See e.g. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/switch-32-bit-64-bit as one reference on this language.
Display usage of variables in --command argument (#469)

issue_comments.body:
Makes total sense to change that URL. Can you also watch out for other left-overs? At least I have found one in:
https://raw.github.com/mozilla/mozregression/master/README.md

Would be good to get them fixed in one patch.
Oh, right. Sorry that I missed that. Looks good to me then. Mind landing yourself?
I did it for you now. Thanks for the patch Matt.
@k0s, it would be great if we could merge --squash pull requests in the future to avoid interim states of the fix landing on the official branches.

commit_comments.body: For Python 3.x compatibility you might want to start to use `except XYZ as ex`. Comma will no longer be allowed.

commits.message: Minor tweaks to README.md file (#467)
Handle Fennec's switch to android-api-16 builds (#460)

pull_requests.title: Bug 1426105 - Make elimination branch detection work with find fix runs.
pull_requests.body:
Call _reverse_if_find_fix() when there is no explicit branch in commit message,
so find fix runs can continue onto integration branches.

issue_comments.body: Great addition!

Thanks! I'll take a look at this. Just FYI Github stuff:

for other projects, it's better to do this kind of work in a remote branch that isn't master, in case the upstream doesn't take your changes and your master becomes dirty.

Also, you don't need to make a new pull request if you want to add another commit, a pull request will pick up any new commits to the branch you made the pull request from.
Thank you _so_ much for this pull request. I've merged it and uploaded mozregression 0.5.2 to pypi.
Fantastic change, thank you!
Merged, thanks! I changed the slashes to commas in the printout though, I thought it was a bit more English-y for the manual testers.

review_comments.body: the rest of the file is four-space indent, we'll want to be consistent.
You'll want to get the exact changeset from used to build the nightly.
goodAppInfo/badAppInfo has the exact changesets of the nightlies.
Might be good to make a function out of this block of code at this point so we can re-use printing the message and building the changesets.
I get a "TypeError: cannot concatenate 'str' and 'tuple' objects" here, lastGoodChangeset is a tuple with (repo, changeset)
now getting "UnboundLocalError: local variable 'firstBadChangeset' referenced before assignment"

Make sure you don't miss any changesets by doing changesetFromDay(), the nightly build is usually built from whatever tip is at around 3am or 4am that morning, so lastChangeSet() might miss 3 to 4 hours of changsets.

issue_comments.body: made the requested changes and squashed again to keep things clean

review_comments.body: fixed
fixed
thanks :)
fixed
oh no...this just made sense to me. I will think about how to solve this...

issue_comments.body: That is on a different branch so would have to be fixed in a different pull request from what I understand.
I would if I had access
I agree with wlach that mozdevice would be better.
I'm going to go ahead and merge and write a follow-up issue.  If this helps testing now, that's a plus, and the mozregression code is not exactly wonderful as is
see also https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/issues/44

I'm not really interested in expending the extra effort to do this.  I inherited maintaining mozregression and have kept the workflow ABICT that is neither documented nor specified anywhere: namely, the typical github workflow == github issues + pull requests.  Quite frankly, I don't like or approve of either of these.  For some reason, github does not have a squash option wrt pull requests. This is one of the things I pretty much consider part of accepting 3rd party workflow. I am perfectly willing to turn project management over to someone that has more time.

That said, none of this is really germaine to his issue or pull request.

So it looks like I bitrotted you :( my apologies.  Could you rejigger the thingies so that it works?

Also, ABICT, we don't need any of the self.binary logic found in Nightly.**init** anymore.  Assuming my assessment is accurate, could we remove?

Looks good, if rather hard to read since for reasons I don't understand github displays the code from commits already in master o_O . The android issue will have to be looked at; tbh, I haven't tried mozregression with android.  You are indeed correct that self-binary should be handled separately for these cases.  I'll do a follow up for that.  In any case, its probably easiest to merge this end and deal with the fall-out.

Now I get this....very strange :(

(mozregression)│moznightly 
Downloading nightly from 2012-11-20
Installing nightly
Starting nightly
['/home/jhammel/mozilla/src/mozregression/src/mozregression/moznightlyapp/firefox', '-profile', '/tmp/tmpxCYRBn.mozrunner']
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/jhammel/mozilla/src/mozregression/bin/moznightly", line 8, in <module>
    load_entry_point('mozregression==0.6.4', 'console_scripts', 'moznightly')()
  File "/home/jhammel/mozilla/src/mozregression/src/mozregression/mozregression/runnightly.py", line 270, in cli
    runner.start(get_date(options.date))
  File "/home/jhammel/mozilla/src/mozregression/src/mozregression/mozregression/runnightly.py", line 229, in start
    if not self.app.start(self.profile, self.addons, self.cmdargs):
  File "/home/jhammel/mozilla/src/mozregression/src/mozregression/mozregression/runnightly.py", line 134, in start
    self.runner.start()
  File "/home/jhammel/mozilla/src/mozregression/src/mozbase/mozrunner/mozrunner/runner.py", line 183, in start
    self.process_handler.run(timeout, outputTimeout)
  File "/home/jhammel/mozilla/src/mozregression/src/mozbase/mozprocess/mozprocess/processhandler.py", line 621, in run
    self.proc = self.Process(self.cmd, **args)
  File "/home/jhammel/mozilla/src/mozregression/src/mozbase/mozprocess/mozprocess/processhandler.py", line 76, in **init**
    universal_newlines, startupinfo, creationflags)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 679, in **init**
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1249, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 13] Permission denied
Exception AttributeError: "'ProcessHandler' object has no attribute 'proc'" in <bound method Runner.cleanup of <mozrunner.runner.Runner object at 0xa75374c>> ignored

Oh, I see what's happening here....

For reasons I have forgotten and are undocumented and should be documented, just calling mozinstall.install returns the path to the folder that the application is in.  Additionally, get_binary must be called to get the path to the binary
(Also, in the future, please test changes when possible)
hopefully fixed: https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/pull/48#issuecomment-10564446
gah, by which i mean: https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/commit/6569504fd82a208520805acfd0ba07a270e356d4
Good catch!  That would indeed explain things
This wfm.  I'd like to see force32bits deprecated in the future.

Sorry, I should have been more specific.  I would like https://github.com/mozilla/mozregression/pull/53/files#L0R183 to work more like runnightly and have --bits={32,64} (on systems where it makes sense, anyway) with the default being chosen based on some sort of common sense.

review_comments.body: This should probably be a choice parameters, allowing 32 or 64 bit regardless of your current platform.  The default can come from mozinfo. (E.g. parser.add_option("--bits", choices=(32,64), default=mozinfo.bits, ...)
ABICT, mozinfo.bits is the integer 64, not the string
I prefer alpha-ordered imports followed by the from import blocks, but this is fine.
any reason not to use revisions.sort(key=...) here?
no need for a line continuation
Also, I'd probably just use a list comprehension v filter, but not a big deal

issue_comments.body:
So I think you need to close this pull request before I can make another.

I've included your updates above in my forked repo and also added the changes to re-fix Issue #33.

Also, I left in the self.binary under FennecNightly as a comment because I wasn't sure if this uses a different binary location. I can remove it if you'd like. `mozregression --app=fennec` doesn't seem to work on my system.

Let me know if I need to do anything else.
Mac apparently is relying on this code: https://github.com/mozilla/mozbase/blob/master/mozrunner/mozrunner/runner.py#L89
@k0s Thanks for the feedback. I'll make the changes and re-send the pull request.

commit_comments.body: mozdevice? 0.22? ;)
Why try/catch this since you have it as a dependency?

Does the print() support print(arg1, arg2, arg3)?
You use two different print syntax in those two lines ? Is this justified?
Is this the config module to have such responsability to exit if ParseError?

"Leave blank to use the default value" or "Leave blank to use this value." seems clearer to me.
It isn't totally obvious that the value recommanded is the default value.
(UPDATE) Don't take my earlier propositions, Your sentence in the  _get_persist_size_limit is better:
(UPDATE) => "I recommend you to use %s GiB, so leave it blank to use that default. Else you"

A comma would be appropriate.
=> " really don't want a persist dir, type NONE,"
I read "persist dir type" the first time.
This time I understood directly. Weird. Is it because it is in the same sentence?

Why print?
(UPDATE) Okay to add '\n' just to better format output I guess. Why not.
Ah, unfortunately this fail on windows if the user did not installed curses... So I don't see an other choice of, but I should add a comment to mention it. Thanks :)
hm, this is only to avoid using backslashes - I am using the parenthesis only for that purpose, but I don't mind changing it if that makes sense to you.

Well, it was already the case before (in cli.py module). I guess it does not hurt because there is no obvious other use I can see for that function (catching ther exception to do something else). Still another option would be to raise an error, and catch that in the main file to exit. Well, why not if that make sense to you, I'm ok with that change. :)
Thanks for updating GUI version. It now works with "autoland" branch
